pageContext.claim: “Even with normalized interest rates, President Obama was paying nothing. And we have a much better economy. And you have to look at our economy also from the day after my election, because we picked up tremendous steam the day after the election. That's not attributable to President Obama. They only did that because of us.”
pageContext.analysis: Obama came into office during a historic recession, so interest rates were set to near-zero -- because the government had to stimulate economic growth to climb out of the hole. Trump inherited a growing economy, so the circumstances are not comparable. The Fed has raised interest rates to prevent an overheated economy, which could spark a recession.
